metadata.title: CVE-2017-6188 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Munin before 2.999.6 has a local file write vulnerability when CGI graphsare enabled. Setting multiple upper_limit GET parameters allows overwritingany file accessible to the www-data user.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

munin - 2.0.19-3ubuntu0.2
munin-async - 2.0.19-3ubuntu0.2
munin-common - 2.0.19-3ubuntu0.2
munin-node - 2.0.19-3ubuntu0.2
munin-plugins-core - 2.0.19-3ubuntu0.2
munin-plugins-extra - 2.0.19-3ubuntu0.2
munin-plugins-java - 2.0.19-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: munin package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.19-3ubuntu0.2').
